description: Generates a personality profile based on input text.

parameters.name: version_date
parameters.description: Release date of the API version in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: A maximum of 20 MB of content to analyze, though the service requires much less text; for more information, see [Providing sufficient input](https://console.bluemix.net/docs/services/personality-insights/input.html#sufficient). A JSON request must conform to the `Content` model.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: The type of the input: application/json, text/html, or text/plain. A character encoding can be specified by including a `charset` parameter. For example, "text/html;charset=utf-8".

parameters.name: content_language
parameters.description: The language of the input text for the request: Arabic, English, Japanese, Korean, or Spanish. Regional variants are treated as their parent language; for example, `en-US` is interpreted as `en`. The effect of the `content_language` header depends on the `Content-Type` header. When `Content-Type` is `text/plain` or `text/html`, `content_language` is the only way to specify the language. When `Content-Type` is `application/json`, `content_language` overrides a language specified with the `language` parameter of a `ContentItem` object, and content items that specify a different language are ignored; omit this header to base the language on the specification of the content items. You can specify any combination of languages for `content_language` and `Accept-Language`.

parameters.name: accept_language
parameters.description: The desired language of the response. For two-character arguments, regional variants are treated as their parent language; for example, `en-US` is interpreted as `en`. You can specify any combination of languages for the input and response content.

parameters.name: raw_scores
parameters.description: If `true`, a raw score in addition to a normalized percentile is returned for each characteristic; raw scores are not compared with a sample population. If `false` (the default), only normalized percentiles are returned.

parameters.name: csv_headers
parameters.description: If `true`, column labels are returned with a CSV response; if `false` (the default), they are not. Applies only when the `Accept` header is set to `text/csv`.

parameters.name: consumption_preferences
parameters.description: If `true`, information about consumption preferences is returned with the results; if `false` (the default), the response does not include the information.
